reviews.text:
Tap (Rotterdam, Helsinki) (5:3:5:3:11=2.7)
Pale, hazy, small head. Light palate. Gentle salty wheaty aroma, blander taste. Weak sauce, but vaguely drinkable.

Bottle. Color: Clear pale golden, white head. Taste: Rather strange mix of below medium sweet, soft sour and lightly salty notes and some pretty weird spicy candy-like notes, probably the seaweed. Thin body, a bit like flavored spring water. Below average carbonation. Very different from the gose beers I have tasted in Goslar, although I have to admit the the typical salty notes are more present in this beer. Interesting style. Refreshing. Overall not really my beer, but I am glad I had the change to taste it.

8/XI/17 - 33cl bottle from De Hopduvel (Gent) @ home - BB: 23/V/19 (2017-1867) 
Clear pale straw yellow beer, big creamy white head, little stable, falls down quickly. Aroma: pretty dusty, spicy, coriander, little dirty. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: nice acidic start, bit lemony, pretty salty, lime, so obviously I'm thinking of tequila now :p, little spicy. Aftertaste: spicy touch, bit fruity, lime juice, bit saline, slightly bitter, pretty refreshing, was hoping to get more of that sea weed.
hazy pale yellow colour, huge dense white head; aroma of lemonade, wine cellar, coriander and tropical fruity notes; taste of lemon, wet breadcrust, some tropical fruitiness and salt; good gose

330ml bottle (Rotterdam, Helsinki). Hazy yellow color. Small size, white head, stays. Citrus, clove, ginger, sweet in aroma. Citrus, clove, sour, vanilla, salty, woody in taste. It's raining outside so not really drink for that day. But in hot summer day I would quaff it no doubt.
Bottle shared with tderoeck. Many thanks! Hazy yellow colour, lots of white foam. Tart, salty, lemony, bit bready. Tequila flavours, medium carbonation.
Hazy MineralMaster mit den softTarty GrainBlowOut. LemonKick & spicy Heuyness...was wolln wir Swimmer more??? ðŸ˜‰âœ¨ . 0,33l Flasche aus Holland....
Nice refreshing brew. Pale yellow with a good head and medium carbonation. Nicely sour with malts and sone coriander in the flavor. Had it on tap atvthe Jopen church in haarlem.
Bottle. Hazy yellow colour. Moderate white head. Average retention. Aroma: salt, spice, pleasant yeast. Light body. Light sour taste. Refreshing. Slightly salty. Wheaty. Spicy. Not bad at all.
16-08-17 // bottle shared from GetrÃ¤nke Stumpf. Hazy yello beer, pale, small head. Very light, mild salty, seawater.

Hazy light golden, medium white head; aroma is soft sour, fruity and citric, sweet, grainy, mineralic; taste is slightly tart, salty, soft fruity, Koriander; texture is thick and creamy with low to medium carbonation and a light to medium body;

Bottle. Hazy yellow color with creamy white head. Aroma is lemony, lacto, dough, touch of salt. Taste is lemony, more dough, wheat, lacto, a bit herbal, with a refreshing saltiness. Silky mouthfeel, medium carbonation, mineralic finish. Super-refreshing, with a nice lemon-and-salt character. Works very well, although itâ€™s unspectacular.
Tap at oedipus. Pours pale yellow. Aroma is puke, acidic, wheat, lacto cube nonsense. Flavor is also lacto cube nonsense. Body is watery. It has some nice lemon sourness, but otherwise nah.

Bottle bought 08/2017, BB date 23.5.2018. Nice head, very pale, slightly hazy. OK. Tart aroma, with some fruitiness. Delicate, pretty good. Tastes tart, almost sour, with some citrus fruitiness. After the first few sips, this becomes more and more pleasant. Mouthfeel medium full, slight drying towards the end, a bit oily. Not bad at all, would be excellent on a hot day, if we ever had any (in Finland). pH about 2.9 (quite low, but a bit uncertain as my pH strips disagreed a bit).

0.33 l bottle @ Leijuva Lahna, Helsinki. Appearance is golden, hazy and no head. Taste has citrus fruits, mainly lemon. This is on the light side of goses - I didnâ€™t notice any salt (this has Celtic sea salt). Quite refreshing and easy to drink.

Tap. Tasted on the 12/05/2017 at TapHouse (Copenhagen). Hazy yellow colour with a small white head. Aroma of light malts, lemon, slightly salt and tart. Taste is light sour and salty with a slightly citrus finish. Next one please!
Bottle. Clear yellow color big white head. Coriander aroma with subtle lemon. Taste is earthy coriander, straw, very light tartness. Easy drinking summer beer.
Draft - soured wheat and nice salty notes. Clear yellow gold with a small white head. Soured wheat, nice salt and a very clean finish. Solid.

On tap at the Taphouse Copenhagen. Leicht trÃ¼bes hell goldgelbes Bier mit einer geringen weiÃŸen schaumkrone. Geruch ist leicht sÃ¤uerlich fruchtig, limetten, Salz. Geschmack ist mild sÃ¤uerlich fruchtig limetten, Ingwer, spritzig, okay.

(bottle) hazy pale golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of lemon juice and tobacco, with some notes of treebark, barnyard and soy sauce. flavour is mostly wheat, white wine vinegar and passion fruit juice, slightly sweet, with a touch of bread dough and a slightly salty semi-dry finish. medium-bodied with lively carbonation.

From 0.33 L bottle; pours cloudy and straw yellow with a white head. Aroma is fresh, slightly sour, some malt and yeast also a little spiciness, otherwise a bit flat. Taste is much more intense, medium sour, light bitter with a herbal influence and slightly citrus. Short to medium long finish, slightly dry. Nice mouthfeel, some kind of thicker consistence (eventually because of the salt), lively carbonation. Nice!
Een gose, stijl lijkt erg op een Berliner weisse. Zuur en fruitig, flink tonen van citrus. Je moet er van houden.
Draught at Gollem. Cloudy yellow with a thin white head. Aroma of grain and salt. Flavour is lime bread, salt, nicely balanced, nothing too dominant.

Bottle at home. Pours clear gold with a medium, creamy white head, long retention with light lacing. Aroma is moderate earthy and grainy wheat malt, salt and light lactic acid. Flavor is light salt, chalky lactic acid sourness, earthy and grainy wheat malt with a dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation.

On tap at Jopen, Haarlem. Nose is fruity. Body is hazy yellow, head is big, white, creamy, mostly lasting, excellent lacing. Aroma is tropical fruits, green tea. Light sweet, medium sour. Finish is medium lasting fruity citric medium sour. Medium body, slick texture, soft carbonation. Easy, refreshing, interesting, nice one.
Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty spicy weak sour yeasty aroma. Fruity malty weak sour flavor. Has a fruity malty weak sour finish.
Cloudy lemon yellow with no head. Smells of lemon and warm wheatfields with a funky finish. Salty, sour, with a nice bready undertone. Light bodied and fresh. Really excellent.

Bottle:
Nearly clear, pale, slightly rosed gold with a small white head.
Grain, salt, lemon scent.
Milky lemon, grain malt, salt flavour.
Nice and simple....
Pretty much a textbook example.
33cl bottle. This is a pleasant gose, thirst-quenching and never overbearing with acidity.
On tap at Jopenkerk, Haarlem. Pours hazy golden, medium white head. Citrus, wheat, some salt, yeast. Sweetish with some acidity. Light bodied. More body would be nice.

Keg at North Bar, Leeds. A hazy golden yellow colour with a thin white head. Aroma of lemon, lime, some seaweed, slight green apple, a little vinegar and subtle salt water. Taste of lemon, green apple, some lime, slight seaweed, a little salt water, a hint of tartness and subtle floral notes. Light bodied and an oily texture. A dry, slightly tart and salty, green apple finish. An interesting Gose, green apple and lemon dominate with slight tartness and subtle sweetness. Decent.

Bottle. Sour milk, lemon. biscuit malt, and straw aroma. Hazy pale yellow with moderate head. Mildly sweet-tart lemon, milky biscuit malt, light salt, and very mildly bitter straw flavor. Good body. A great straight-forward gose.

the aroma of garden fruits and sour milk with hints of yellow plum, sour apple and flowers... the taste is fruity and spicy with notes of sour orange, green apple, lemon, lacto and sea salt... sour and dry aftertaste...

03-11-2016-0,33 L Flasche. Hellgelb, leicht trÃ¼b, weisser Schaum.
Aroma: Hefig, wÃ¼rzig. Antrunk salzig, wÃ¼rzig, hefig, im Ausklang steigende SÃ¤ure - gute Gose!
On tap at Monnik Beer Co. Pours a cloudy yellow gold with medium frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is lemon zest, salt, wheat. Thin body, tart lemon, strong sea salt, wheat, crisp finish, good.

On tap.
Pours gold with full head.
Aromas of corn, salt and light citrus.
Flavors of sea salt, dry wheat, and dried lemons.
Nice
Intense sour smell. Sour, salty taste with hints of coriander. Good beer, extra bonuspoints because my wife loves it.

Lightly opaque pale gold beer with a cloudy head.
Smell is rather absent - hint of chlorine, hay.
Taste is salty sourness, fizzy and refreshing. Crispy lemon.
Tap @ Highlanders. Hazy yellow with small white head. Aroma is malt, yeast, hop, lemon, lacto and lemon. Flavour is malt, lemon, salt, spices, lacto, little sweet, notes of sourness and a little dry.
0,33l bottle from K-Citymarket Ruoholahti. Pours hazy yellow with a medium head. Aroma is tarty malts. Flavor is tarty malts with some vinegar and some salt. Great.

Tap @ Highlanders, Aarhus. Hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, lemon and light tart. Flavor is medium sweet, moderate bitter and slightly acidic. Sweet and moderate bitter finish with an acidic edge and a hint of salt. 051016

Bottle
Aroma-barnyard
Appearance-pale, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, salty, 
Palate-light body, thin feel, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-refreshing
Bottle at home. Pours light hazy yellow with small white head. Aroma has citrus and some grapes. Taste is light and sour. Subtle malts, citrus, floral hops. Bit watery. Bit short. Not that great.
[emailÂ protected] hki. Yellowy hazy. Wheaty, bit dull, some citrus on nose. Ligght. Easy. Creamy wheaty flavour. Decent. Boring tho.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Draft at Cafe Gollem Overtoomstraat Amsterdam, The Netherlands. Pour it hazy yellow color with medium white head. Aroma funky sourness, salty feel. Taste salty, lemony, licorice, earthy, herbs, medium body, slick feel, lively, bitter. Interesting.
Aroma: Milky ferment cheesy, salt, citrus, spicy Appearance: Light yellow, light cloudy, low carb, fine foam bubbles, fine lace Taste: Salt, sour, lemon, light sour finish.

A light yellow beer, strong bubbling, a head is big and blond. Aroma has lemon, tartness and wheat. Taste has lemon, light wheat, nice and medium tartness, some salt. Quite light bodied, strong carbonation and nicely fresh. Succesfully and balanced. Tasteful and refreshning.

Bottled. 
Poured light golden, unclear with a thin white head. 
Wheaty, salty and spicy brew. Pleasant wit aroma, flavor quite tart, some salt and apricots. Light and refreshing. Citrus in finish as well.
Bottle. Hazy straw color, white head. Salty, lightly sour flavor with citric notes. Lingering taste of the sea. Medium-light body, medium carbonation. Kind of weird.

Licht geel, troebel, witte schuimkraag die snel weg is. Veel koolzuur bubbels zichtbaar.
Aroma: Licht zuur, groen onrijp fruit, bloemig en iets aarde en iets kruidig..... Bij opwarming wat mouten en gist.
Smaak: zuur, groene appel, cider, limoen, grassig,Â  zoutig, iets koriander.... erg fris en prikkelig, weinig bitter.
Body is licht, veel koolzuur en iets waterig.
Makkelijk weg te drinken deze Gose Collaboration.

Bottle shared at The Watford BBQ Tasting as â€™Jopen Coastal Goseâ€™. Many thanks to Fergose for another gose. Pale greeny yellow, hazy, small foamy white head, sparse lacing. Aroma is airy, papery, damp stones, gravel path. Body is light, spritzy carbonation, foamy. Taste is sparkling water, light lemon notes, papery and salty touches. Interesting, as goses always are, but just overcarbonated and on the thin side for me. (3.0)
Citroengele kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt ruikt niet zoveel, kruiden, licht zuur. Smaakt fruitig iets zurig.
Geel ondoorzichtig bier met een goede witte schuim kraag. Ruikt fruitig, zuur en ziltig. Smaakt zuur, ziltig, droog, boerderij. Niet de beste gose ooit.

33cl Bottle shared. a slight hazy yellow colour with a decent creamy white head 
Aroma: wheat, citrus, lemon. 
Taste: sour and salty, with some koriander,, lactose gentle sourness finishes dry. .
 Body is light to medium. A refreshing gose, like you expect.
Chugged this in 5 seconds in between successive shots of Evan Williams. It was refreshing.
Draught @ Bier&Big festival, Eindhoven. Cloudy straw yellow, white creamy head. Watery, lightly sour, dry, tard. Low carbonation.

Bottle thanks to Fergus. It pours lightly hazy pale yellow with a small white head. The aroma is earthy, salty, grassy, herbal and light lactic vibe. The taste is crisp, tart, salted lemons, minerals, lactic acidity, grass, cracker and earth with a dry finish. Medium body and fine, prickly carbonation. Easy drinking stuff. Not bad,

Bottle shared at the Watford tasting, many thanks to Me. A hazed yellow , straw coloured pour with a fine white head. Aroma is zippy lemon rind, salty, pithy lemon, floral cirrus. Palate is crisp and dry, refreshing, pithy lemon, highish carbonation. Flavour is composed of tangy pithy lemon rind, tangy, salty, straw. Good stuff.

Bottle shared in Watford - big thanks to Fergus! Pours lightly hazy yellow-gold with a frothy, white head. Light hay in the nose, dry wheat, lemon peel. Light sweet flavour with ripening lemon, low acidity, mild bitterness. Light bodied with average carbonation. Finishes with moderate lemony tang, more relaxed acidity, faint bitter straw. Drinks pretty good.
Hazy straw blond colour with lasting thin head. Light bodied. Fine carbonation. Flavour is very citrusy and has a salty sea water edge.
Hazy pale color, small head. Pleasant light malt aroma. Taste is sour, with some salt notes. Thin texture, abrupt finish.
330ml bottle poured at Rootz At The Harbour, Scheveningen - A golden body, hazy and cloudy with little head. Nose is sea water, and herbs. Taste is nice salty and crisp. Gose down nicely.
Bottle thanks to Maakun. Pours yellow white head - nose/taste of yellow white head - nose/taste of lemon, coriander, sea salt, light lactose sourness - lighter medium body

33cl bottle at home. pours a slight hazy yellow colour with a decent creamy white head which leaves a layer on top. Aroma of yeast, citrus, coriander, salty, funky. Taste is light sweet, medium bitter and medium acidic. Notes of citrus, yeast, coriander, salt, funk, grainy. Texture is thin, light bodied and decent carbonation.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2016 330ml Bottle from trade with MonsterMagnet. Thank you! Pours hazy yellow, good foamy white head. Aroma is lemon citrus and sherbet. Taste is lightly sour, lightly crisp, good lemon citrus and the slightest hint of funk. Exceedingly dry finish. Pleasant and true to the style.

Bottle from Maakun in Euro Local Swap 1/2016, many thanks! Pours hazy pale yellow with quite dense,creamy, white head. Citrus/lemon aroma with some wheat and some mineral salt. Lightly tart citrus taste with hints of salt and herbs. Very light and refreshing.

Very fine & dense white head over very lightly veiled pale yellow beer. Wheat and seasalt, cilandro, lime. Very nice aromatic, floral smell. Equally nice citric, lime-like flavour; with citurs, lime, lemonblossom, and more than faint lactic acid, buttermilk. Light body, fine pearling sensation from the carbonation. This is excellent! A rare gem. And I fear a lot of people just donâ€™t understand this beer.

Bottle from Bierwinkel Zeist, BB 28 Jul 2017, large sample. Hazy yellow color, medium rocky head. Aroma of wheat, lemon, coriander, minerally. Grainy sweetness, bit chewy lemon and citric acid (like zure matjes). Bit thin body, medium carbonation. Decent.
Milky pale yellow color with some foam. Shy light fresh nose. Salty, milky sour, dry, fruity taste. Dry and sourish aftertaste.

UPDATED: FEB 29, 2016 Bottle, courtesy of Koelschtrinker. A very light and almost flavourless Gose. Low salt, but matching very well. Slightly funky nose. A bit too thick for the otherwise very light beer.

33 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ W. van Schaik, Vianen.
Milky yellow with a thin white head. Sour wheat aroma. Sour taste with some saltiness. Weird but interesting and quite refreshing.

33cl flesje bij De Zwaan, Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 4,5%
Uitgeschonken in origineel Jopen glas

Uiterlijk: lichtgeel/troebel met vaste witte schuimkraag

Aroma en smaak: zurig, ziltig, citroen

Conclusie: niet mijn ding, lekkerst op een warme zomerdag denk ik, meer vrouwenmateriaal

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2016 33cl bbJUL2017, bought in Tilburg 2015. - Tastefully balanced marine brine, light salt (Moroccan lemon), coriander fruitsoap and citrus bitters in an easygoing, summer sessioner of a Gose with great lactic wheat milk character (Milchreis, Molke and oysters). The only thing not sessionable are Dutch craft beer prices for Limited Collab brews like this, paired with their tax laws... // Draught (!) @3. Berliner Weisse Gipfel March 2016: lovely balance of whey lactic notes, brine minerals, deep sea salts and a hidden coriander-spiked Witbier hidden among those.

Bottle shared with G. Pours light hazy golden with hardly any head. Sour slightly musty nose. Taste is a little sour but very watery in the mouth and on the finish. A little too sodary. Have had much better.

Bottle brought back from a trip to Amsterdam and shared with Pix. Pours hazy straw coloured with a rapidly fading white head. Very light lemony aroma. The taste is tart lemons with a slightly salty finish. Very zingy and refreshing. Not complex by any means, but very enjoyable. Good beer.

33cl bottle. Poured a slightly hazy straw colour with a thin broken white head. The aroma is mineral acid citrus. The flavour is light sour with a soft tart lemon citrus acid palate. Light to medium bodied with average carbonation.
Haarlem Culinair Speciaalbierfestival Botermarkt. Citroen snufje zout verfrissend en doordrinkbaar. Backlog from 2015/08/09.

330ml bottle. Slightly milky, yellow-ish, pale golden colour with average, frothy, fairly lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Spicy, herbal-salty aroma, hints of salted lemon and coriander. Taste is mildly tart, salty, hints of lemon juice, soured milk, a touch of black pepper and coriander. Nothing spectacular, but a nice, mild and beginnerâ€™s compatible Gose.
Draft. A hazy golden beer with a lazing white head. The aroma has notes of wheat, straw, and vinegar. The flavor is acidic with notes of wheat, lacto, and straw, leading to a tart finish.
From tap at Taphouse. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of spice, hops, salt, citrus and crispy.
From tap. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is citrusy and crisp fruity. Citrusy, mild fruity, toasted and grainy. Citrusy fruity finish.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2015 Bottle, hazy pale yellow with a white head. Light sour aroma with lemon, wheat and salt. Taste follows and is somewhat stronger. Although I can?t name many flavours it is full of it. Well balanced, mild and very refreshing beer

Draught @ Jopen Proeflokaal Amsterdam, Lange Leidsedwarsstraat 4-6 hs, Amsterdam, Netherlands 1017 NL. [ As Jopen / Del Ducato Coastal Gose ].Unclear light to medium orange yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, moderate yeasty, fruity, tart fruit, soured milk notes. Flavor is moderate sweet and light to moderate acidic with a long duration, tart citrus - fruit, yeasty, fruity, salty notes. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20150923]
Clear with foggy yellow apearance. Fresh arama, light salty taste. Quite fresh beer and aftertaste. Nice. (Velp 201511)
Feine Fruchtigkeit mit angenehmer SÃ¤ure. Dazu ein wenig Essig, Zitrone, durchaus vollmundig und sehr einfach zu trinken. VernÃ¼nftige Balance, die nicht weh tut.

Bottle brought home from Eindhoven. The beer has got a hazy golden-whitish colour with an airy head and medium to thin body. Aroma of hops, citric and bread. Taste of old hops, citric, flowers, white bread, straw and dust. Citric finish.

On tap at Jopenkerk, Haarlem. Pours hazy light yellow with a tiny white head. Aroma is lemony acidity, citrus, yeast, taste is similar very rich for a gose with bread and grain notes. Nice final saltiness. Medium body, less watery than the usual Gose, lively carbonation. Excellent.

(Draught at Jopenkerk, Haarlem, 27 Aug 2015) Cloudy yellow colour with frothy, white head. Fruity nose with notes of citrus, lemon peel, grass and white bread. Fruity taste with white bread, lemon, coriander and grass. Medium body, with a touch of sweetness and hardly any bitterness. Fresh and tasty, but not very salty. Quite nice.

26th September 2015Post Borefts VII, Day 2 - Den Haag walkabout. Bierspeciaalcafe De Paas. Bottle. Hazy gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is light and mildly crisp. Mild savoury note and a little sweet floralness. Tangy ripe orange. Trace of lemon before a mildly crisp finish. Not bad.

(Jopen/Del Ducato Coastal Gose) Bottle 330 ml at home, servedd into a glass tankard, ABV 4.5%
Piss yellow colour on the body, mostly clear, with good activity in it. Tall and thick, snow white head, with very good retention.
Aroma of wheat with light sour notes, white wine and grapes.
Nicely sour taste, matches pretty well with the salty notes. Lemons are also present, wheat.
Medium thin body, good carbonation, maybe a bit high. 
Good, highly drinkable.
Tap at arends nest... Golden yellow amber. Soft salty fruits.. Soft zezty fruits.. Salty lemon fruits
[9/23/15] Draught at Arendsnest in Amsterdam. Hazy pale yellow. Aroma of wheat, a bit of lacto, coriander, citrus. Sourish flavor, salty, with wheat, coriander, lacto. Quite light-bodied. Refreshing.
Bottle. Golden blonde. Lemon, Apple and a hint of salt in the aroma. Sour, soft salty flavor. Apple and gooseberries. Friendly, Refreshing. Short aftertaste.
Spritzig sÃ¤uerlicher, runder Antrunk. SÃ¼ffig, sehr erfrischend, minimale Herbe. Geringe WÃ¼rzigkeit. Gut! 10/10/11/10//10

reviews.location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, England
reviews.text:
Keg at Cafe De Paas, Den Hague, 26/09/15.
Hazed yellow with a decent off white covering. 
Nose is citric peel, straw, light dirt, seaweed.
Taste comprises lemon drizzle, straw, farmy, salt licks, light yeast.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close. 
Refreshing enough gose with a light puckering finale.

Spina @ eurhop 2015.
Chiara con bella schiuma.
In stile, molto marina.
Va giÃ¹ bene  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Mi4i

Keg at Jopen Kerk at Haarlem, Netherlands, Wednesday 7th October 2015.   Hazy lemony colour with lacy white head. Zaps tge tongue straight away but soon mellows, tart with a cooked slight briney lemonyness. Itâ€™s refreshing, itâ€™s nice, but one is enough for me. A7 A4 T7 P3 Ov14 3.5

250 ml. draft @ Bierspeciaalcafe De Paas. Post-Borefts 2015. Day 1. Hazy orange, creamy solid white head. Nose is sweetish yeast, heavily mineral, salty almost, big sweetish thick creamy yeast with a profile quite similar to mineral sparkling water. Taste is basic, heavy on the salt oddly so, heavily mineral mixed with some sweet yeast, bread, basic lactic sourness, wheat, heavy on the salt. Body is salty, mineral, thin. Odd, interesting but problematic. Nice attempt. Interesting for sure.
Draught. Pale yellow coloured. Unclear. Dense light beige head. Aroma. Citrus, fruits, spice. Flavour. Citrus, sourness, fruits, spice. Medium bodied. Ends dry and sour.
Bottle. Pours hazy, pale yellow (i.e., looks like a goze). Aroma is citrus and salt. Texture is very round and oily, nearly impenetrable. Flavor is again citrus, salt, very sour. Not bad.

Love a good experiment, beer reeks so should have a higher grade. The sourness is lovely though.

Bottle from De Zwart Wilnis
Keg at arendsnest. Pours hazy pale yellow, nose is floral, salty, fruity, taste is quite salty, sour, fruity.

Draught at Arendsnest.
Hazy golden colored with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of caramel and citrus.
Fruity and light acidic flavor of spices and citrus.
Citric finish.

Yellow hazy color with a nice bright white head of good stability.
The nose is quite malty and somewhat â€™greenâ€™ - untypical for a Gose. A good beer to trouble people during a blind tasting ;-)
The flavour is nevertheless salty-sour, refreshing and light. Nice summer beer. 
I miss a bit the coreander that was used.

On tap at Arends Nest Amsterdam. Very pale gold hazy lasting white head. Light lemony aroma. Little bit of lemon soap in mouth then it turns lemon juice sour leaving a sour finish. Decent lemony sour beer. Vague salt maybe. No real malt. Itâ€™s like lemon barley water. OK.

33cl bottle at home. Pale yellow with a medium white soapy head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Salty sourness with some subtle bitter tones in the background. Green apples, salt, coriander, herbs and grain. A weird but nice sour brew.
Bottle at home. Aroma of wheat, citrus, lemon. Flavour is moderate sour and salty. Finish is rather dry. Body is light to medium. A pleasant refreshing Gose, sufficiently sourish and salty.
Hazy straw yellow color with white foam. Aroma of wheat malt and a little light acid. Taste citrus, coriander and salty.

Draft at De Paas. Pours cloudy blond with a big white head. Aroma is light fruity and mineral with a little citrus, fairly light. Flavour is light moderate sour and moderate salty. Light bodied with a mineral and sharp tart fruit/lemon plate and light to moderate carbonation.

Tap @ Jopen Proeflokaal, Amsterdam. Pours a hazy yellow with a stylish, white head. Aroma is wheaty, some lemon. Taste is light sour, lemon, strong wheat, light salty finish. High carbonation. Light. Good thirst quencher.

bottle at home. poured a hazy yellow to light golden colour with a white head on top. nose of pressed citrus, lemon peel, slight notice of stone fruits, salt, salty tart notes, and some lactose kind of mouthfeel. refreshing aftertaste and medium carbonated.

[emailÂ protected], Amersfoort. 
Appearance: cloudy yellow golden with white head. 
Aroma: coriander, wheat. 
Taste: salty, coriander, medium sour bitter. 
Palate: refreshing, lasting medium body, medium carbonation. 
Overall: interesting.

0.33 l bottle from De Bierkoning, 4.5 % abv, bottled in august 2015. Slightly hazy, pale straw yellow with a thin, frothy, stable, white head. Weak, sourish-citrusy aroma of lemon, rhubarb, gooseberry, coriander and vanilla. Sourish-citrusy taste of lemon, coriander, wheat flour and salt, followed by a short, rather salty and smooth finish. Thin to medium body, smooth and only minimally astringent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Refreshing, mild gose, lacking some fruitiness and punch. Nevertheless easy to drink despite the strong coriander and salt notes. Nice.
Flesje van de jumbo. Troebel goud kleurig. Weinig aroma. Licht zuur. Niet bijzonder.
Draft. Golden fuzzy pour. Aroma of salt, tart and peachy mango. Fresh sour taste, with tart, some peachy bitter and a nice salty finish. Good gose.
Hazy yellow colour. Really big and strong taste of tartness and sea salt. Weirdly refreshing.

On tap. Slightly puky sour aroma with light fruit accents-white grape and cranberry. Cloudy dark yellow under a bubbly white collar. Clean sour flavour with some salt and red cherry and faint lotus root. Light body, high carbonation, clean finish.

Refreshing sourness but salt is faint and it just doesn't work for me. Well made but not for me. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Haarlem Culinair. Hazy golden yellow colour, creamy white head. Aroma of coriander, wheat. Flavour of salt, lemon, raw wheat, tiny hint of smoke, coriander, tart-bitter finish. Light bodied. Bland IMHO.

Tap at Haarlems bierfestival. Cloudy straw with small white head. Lemon, lots of dough and some milk, light spices. Taste is light salty with a hint of sourness. Medium bodied with soft but sparkly carbonation.
Tap at Haarlem Speciaalbierfestival â€™15: Hazy yellow brew with an sharp tangy taste of lemon, hints of salt. So refreshing beer to taste.

Sample @ Haarlem Bierfestival. Pours a hazy straw yellow beer with a very small white head. Aroma is faint, fruity and grapes. Flavour is rather salty and refreshing, cleansing and thirst quenching. Dry and light bitter aftertaste. Decent.
